com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.server.service
Interface GameWorldManager

All Known Subinterfaces:
GameWorldService
All Known Implementing Classes:
GameWorldManagerImpl, GameWorldServiceImpl
public interface GameWorldManager

The GameWorldManager interface exposes application level access to the GameWorldService running inside of the Project Darkstar stack.

Author:
Owen Kellett

Method Detail

trimPath

com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.common.util.Coordinate trimPath(com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.common.util.Coordinate start,
                                                                 com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.common.util.Coordinate end)

Calculate the actual path of a snowman attempting to walk from the given start point to the given end point. This method will check if any barriers are in the snowman's path by checking for an intersection with the Spatial game world by using the CollisionManager. If there is a collision, then a new destination location will be calculated and returned by the CollisionManager.

Parameters:
start - coordinate of the start position
end - coordinate of the destination position
Returns:
actual destination location when collisions are accounted for

validThrow

boolean validThrow(com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.common.util.Coordinate start,
                   com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.common.util.Coordinate end)

Validate that a snowball can be thrown from the start position to the end position. This will verify that there are no collisions with the Spatial game world between the two coordinates at the static THROWHEIGHT.

Parameters:
start - coordinate of the start position
end - coordinate of the target position
Returns:
true if there are no collisions with static entities between the two points
